original: 2. Payment to WYZZ-TV. original: (a) Within seventy-five (75) days following the end of each month of a calendar year during the Term that "BCF" (as defined below) for such month, when combined with BCF for all prior months during such calendar year (other than any month which is outside the Term) is less than the Minimum BCF, Nexstar shall pay a fee to WYZZ in an amount equal to thirty-five percent (35%) of BCF for such month. Within seventy-five (75) days following the end of each month of a calendar year during the Term that BCF for such month, when combined with BCF for all prior months of such calendar year (other than any month which is outside the Term) is greater than the Minimum BCF, Nexstar shall pay a fee to WYZZ in an amount equal to 50% of BCF for such month; provided, in the first month of each calendar year in which this sentence applies, the fee with respect to the portion of BCF for such month which, when combined with BCF for all prior months during such year (other than any month which is outside the Term) is exactly equal to the Minimum BCF, shall equal thirty-five percent (35%) of such portion rather than fifty percent (50%). The amount payable pursuant to either of the prior two sentences (sometimes referred to as the "Section 2(a) Amount") shall be reduced by the sum of (A) 100% of any costs incurred by Nexstar during the applicable month in maintaining, replacing or purchasing capital equipment which is owned by WYZZ or which is used solely in connection with the operation of WYZZ-TV, which costs have not otherwise been deducted in calculating BCF, plus (B) 50% of the cost incurred by Nexstar during the applicable month in maintaining, replacing or purchasing capital equipment which is not owned by WYZZ and which is used in connection with the combined operation of both Stations ("Combined Capital Equipment)", which costs have not otherwise been deducted in calculating BCF. The Minimum BCF shall be Three Million Seven Hundred Thousand Dollars ($3,700,000) for calendar year 2002 and shall be increased on January 1, 2003 and on each January 1 thereafter in an amount equal to the percentage increase in the Consumer Price Index (published by the U.S.
ollama_generated: (a) During each month of the Term within a calendar year, if the accumulated BCF for that month (together with BCF for all prior months during the same calendar year, excluding any month outside the Term) falls below the Minimum BCF, Nexstar will be obligated to pay WYZZ a fee equal to 35% of the BCF for that particular month. Conversely, if the accumulated BCF for the month (together with BCF for all prior months during the same calendar year, excluding any month outside the Term) exceeds the Minimum BCF, Nexstar will pay WYZZ a fee equal to 50% of the BCF for that month. In the first month of each calendar year where this provision applies and the accumulated BCF is exactly equal to the Minimum BCF, Nexstar's payment will be 35% of this portion rather than 50%. The fee owed under either scenario (often referred to as the "Section 2(a) Fee") will be adjusted by the total of (A) all costs incurred by Nextar during that month for maintaining, replacing, or purchasing capital equipment that is owned by WYZZ or used exclusively for WYZZ-TV operation, costs which have not been accounted for in calculating BCF, plus (B) 50% of the costs incurred during the same month for maintaining, replacing, or purchasing capital equipment utilized for both stations collectively ("Combined Capital Equipment"), costs that have also not been factored into the BCF calculation. The Minimum BCF will be set at Three Million Seven Hundred Thousand Dollars ($3,700,000) for the year 2002 and will increase on January 1 of each subsequent year in line with the percentage rise in the Consumer Price Index published by the U.S. government.

original: Furthermore, for the purposes of clarification, to the extent the Section 2(a) Amount for the calendar year is less than zero, the "true-up" shall be done such that WYZZ shall have paid to Nexstar the amount by which the Section 2(a) Amount is less than zero. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained herein for purposes of the period commencing December 1, 2001 and ending December 31, 2001, the Minimum BCF shall be One Dollar ($1.00).
ollama_generated: In addition to the above, it's important to note that when the Section 2(a) Amount for a given calendar year results in a negative figure, the "true-up" process will require Nexstar to receive from WYZZ the absolute value of this negative amount. Contrariwise, for the period spanning December 1, 2001, to December 31, 2001, WYZZ shall be responsible for paying a Minimum BCF equal to One Dollar ($1.00). This provision supersedes any conflicting clauses within this agreement regarding the specified timeframe.

original: (h) On or prior to the 30th day after WYZZ's receipt of the Final BCF Report, WYZZ may give Nexstar a written notice (an "Objection Notice") indicating its objections to the Final BCF Report. If WYZZ does not give Nexstar an Objection Notice within such 30-day period, then the Final BCF Report will be conclusive and binding upon the parties hereto. If WYZZ gives a timely Objection Notice, then Nexstar and WYZZ will negotiate in good faith to resolve their disputes regarding the Final BCF Report. If Nexstar and WYZZ are unable to resolve all disputes regarding the Final BCF Report on or prior to the 30th day after the Objection Notice is given, then Nexstar and WYZZ will retain a "big five" accounting firm (either by mutual agreement or by random choice after eliminating any such firm which is conflicted or otherwise unable to participate) (the "Independent Accounting Firm") to resolve the dispute as soon as practicable, and in any event within thirty (30) days. The BCF for the applicable year as determined by the Independent Accounting Firm will be conclusive and binding upon the parties hereto and will constitute the BCF for such year for all purposes of this Section 2; provided, the parties will use reasonable efforts to limit the scope of the Independent Accounting Firm's review. The fees and expenses of the Independent Accounting Firm in connection with its review of the Final BCF Report shall be paid one-half by Nexstar and one-half by WYZZ.
ollama_generated:
(h) Upon receipt of the Final BCF Report by WYZZ, they will have a 30-day grace period to issue a written notice (an "Objection Notice") expressing any concerns about the report. Failure to submit an Objection Notice within this timeframe implies acceptance and binding agreement on the parties regarding the report's accuracy. In case an Objection Notice is submitted, Nexstar and WYZZ will attempt to resolve their disputes amicably for 30 days. If negotiations fail, either party may choose a "big five" accounting firm (either by mutual consent or random selection after excluding any with conflicts or unavailability) to arbitrate the dispute promptly, but within 30 days of the selection process. The BCF for the relevant year as determined by the appointed accounting firm will be final and binding for all purposes of this Section 2, with efforts made by both parties to keep the scope of the review as minimal as possible. The costs associated with the Independent Accounting Firm's review of the Final BCF Report will be shared equally between Nexstar and WYZZ.

In this version, the clause now implies that WYZZ has a grace period to issue an Objection Notice, emphasizing acceptance if no notice is given within the specified timeframe, and placing more responsibility on both parties for initiating dispute resolution.

ollama_generated:
a. The establishment and allocation of annual budgets (the "Annual Budgets") for the operation of the Stations, as further detailed in Section 11 herein;
   b. The assessment of any single capital expenditure required for either Station, beyond what is provided in the applicable Annual Budget, except that Nexstar shall not be obligated to obtain WYZZ's consent for unbudgeted capital expenditures in excess of Fifty Thousand Dollars ($50,000) in any calendar year if such expenditures are necessary to maintain or restore the normal operations and transmission of the Station;
   c. The selection and dismissal of key employees of the Stations, encompassing general sales managers, national sales managers, and local sales managers (collectively, the "Key Employees"). Nexstar shall not be required to seek WYZZ's consent for the termination of any Key Employee unless WYZZ has explicitly requested such termination;
   d. The engagement of any outside consultants not included in the applicable Annual Budget;
   e. The retention of any Key Employee, subject to the condition that (i) the combined share of market revenue (excluding political) for both Stations in any fiscal quarter is ten percent (10%) or more below the combined share of market revenue (excluding political) for both Stations in the preceding fiscal quarter, and (ii) the combined share of market revenue (excluding political) for both Stations in either the subsequent fiscal quarter or two out of any five fiscal quarters following that quarter, is also ten percent (10%) or more below the combined share of market revenue for both Stations in the preceding fiscal quarter. WYZZ shall only have the right to request the termination of a Key Employee once every eighteen (18) months with respect to any particular Key Employee position;
   f. Any significant adjustment or alteration to the broadcast signal or the transmission of either Station.

original: d. Facilities. 11. Reciprocal Undertakings.

In the event of any action, omission, or non-compliance by one party (the "Defaulting Party") that breaches this Agreement or otherwise causes detriment to the other party (the "Affected Party"), the Defaulting Party shall have an obligation to remedy such breach or take corrective action within a reasonable period of time, as determined by the Affected Party. original: (i) Not later than November 30 of each calendar year during the Term of this Agreement, WYZZ and Nexstar shall agree upon (1) an Operating Budget for the Stations (each an "Annual Operating Budget") setting forth in reasonable detail the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses that Nexstar is expected to incur in performing its obligations hereunder during the upcoming calendar year, including, without limitation, the costs of all Nexstar personnel (including salaries, incentives, commissions, bonuses, benefits, and payroll services), property, equipment (including repairs and maintenance, office space, office space modifications, utilities, sales, marketing costs, and related costs, and (2) a revenue budget for the Stations (the "Annual Revenue Budget" and, together with the Annual Operating Budget, the "Annual Budget") setting forth the projected sales revenues with respect to advertisements for the upcoming calendar year, as well as the assumptions underlying those projections; provided, in no event shall Nexstar have any right to object to the inclusion in the Annual Operating Budget of the cost of any programming which WYZZ determines is to be broadcast on WYZZ-TV, and in no event shall WYZZ have any right to object to the inclusion in the Annual Operating Budget of any programming which Nexstar determines is to be broadcast on WMBD-TV. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, a part of the above-referenced budget approval process shall be the inclusion of proposed commissions or other incentive plans applicable to the sale of advertisements, which plans shall be subject to each Party's approval, as part of their approval of the Annual Operating Budget. The Annual Budget for the one month period beginning December 1, 2001 and Year 2002_ (the "Initial Budget"), is attached hereto as Exhibit H.
modified:
(j) Commencing on December 1 of each year during the term of this Agreement, Nexstar and WYZZ shall collaborate to establish (1) an Annual Operating Plan for the Stations (each a "Yearly Operational Plan"), outlining anticipated expenses for Nexstar's performance of its contractual duties over the subsequent year, including but not limited to salaries, incentives, commissions, bonuses, employee benefits, and payroll services, as well as property, equipment maintenance, office space rentals, utility costs, marketing expenditures, and related expenses. Additionally, (2) a projected revenue plan for the Stations (the "Yearly Revenue Plan" and in conjunction with the Yearly Operational Plan, the "Yearly Financial Plan") detailing estimated revenues from advertisements for the upcoming year, along with the underlying assumptions. It is important to note that Nexstar shall not contest the inclusion of any programming costs as determined by WYZZ for WYZZ-TV within the Yearly Operational Plan, and WYZZ shall not challenge any programming costs determined by Nexstar for WMBD-TV within the Yearly Operational Plan. As part of the approval process for the Yearly Financial Plan, proposed commission or incentive schemes related to advertisement sales shall be included and subject to the mutual agreement of both Parties. The Initial Budget, pertaining to the one-month period starting from December 1, 2001, and Year 2002 (the "Initial Plan"), is provided as Exhibit H.

This revised clause emphasizes collaboration between the parties in establishing annual financial plans rather than explicit agreement, softens the language around budget approval by removing the requirement for complete agreement, and shifts some of the budget-inclusion responsibilities to WYZZ while maintaining Nexstar's prerogative over WMBD-TV programming costs.

original: g. WYZZ's Right to Hire Certain Employees. Upon final termination of this Agreement, WYZZ shall have the obligation to hire any employee of Nexstar solely providing services to WYZZ-TV, including (without limitation) all of the account executives of Nexstar exclusively selling time on WYZZ-TV. The parties shall negotiate in good faith with respect to any rights of WYZZ to hire any other employees of Nexstar who are providing services to both Stations. For a period of one year from the termination of this Agreement, neither Party hereto (or any of its affiliates) will directly or indirectly solicit to employ or employ any of the employees of the other Party hereto if such employees were employed by either of the Stations at any time during the six month period immediately preceding the termination of this Agreement.

The parties will attempt in good faith to reach an agreement regarding any employees of Nextar that WYZZ wishes to retain and who are providing services to both Stations. For a period of one year following the expiration or termination of this Agreement, neither Party (or any of its affiliates) shall be required to refrain from soliciting to employ or employing any of the employees of the other Party if such employees were employed by either of the Stations at any time during the six month period preceding the expiration or termination of this Agreement.

original: c. Indemnification Procedure. Neither WYZZ nor Nexstar shall be entitled to indemnification pursuant to this Section unless such claim for indemnification is asserted in a written notice delivered to the other Party, together with a statement as to the factual basis for the claim and the amount of the claim. Together with such notice or promptly following the delivery thereof, the Party making the claim (the "Claimant") shall make available to the other Party (the "Indemnitor") information relied upon by the Claimant to substantiate the claim. Such notice shall be given promptly following Claimant knowing or having reason to know about such claim; provided, the Indemnitor shall be relieved of a liability for Claimant's failure to provide notice only if, and to the extent, adversely impacted by such failure.
ollama_generated: d. Indemnity Obligation's Activation. Either Nexstar or WYZZ has the right to claim indemnification under this Section, but only if they provide a written notice to the other Party detailing the factual basis for their claim and the amount claimed. The providing Party (the "Claimant") must also make available to the recipient Party (the "Indemnitee") all information used to support the claim upon delivery of such notice or promptly thereafter. Such notice shall be provided as soon as practicable once the Claimant is aware or reasonably should have been aware of the claim; however, the Indemnitee will not be held liable for any delay in providing notice if it is directly prejudiced by the delay.

original: 3L. Real Property. Schedule 3L to this Exhibit contains a complete description of all real property, whether owned or leased (the "Real Property Interests") (including street address, and WYZZ's use thereof) used in connection with the operation of WYZZ-TV. The Real Property Interests listed on Schedule 3L to this Exhibit comprise all interests in real property currently used by WYZZ and necessary to conduct the business and operations of WYZZ-TV as now conducted. Except as described on Schedule 3L to this Exhibit, WYZZ has good title to all Real Property Interests free and clear of all liens, mortgages, pledges, covenants, easements, restrictions, encroachments, leases, charges, and other claims and encumbrances, which restricts WYZZ's interest in, or use of, the Real Property Interests, except for "Permitted Encumbrances" (as defined below). Each leasehold or subleasehold interest is included on Schedule 3L to this Exhibit and is legal, valid, binding, enforceable, and in full force and effect. WYZZ is not in default, violation, or breach under any lease or sublease, and no event has occurred and is continuing that constitutes (with notice or passage of time or both) a default, violation, or breach thereunder.

3L. Real Property Interests and Use: Schedule 3L appended to this Exhibit outlines all real property owned or leased (collectively referred to as "Real Property Interests") utilized in the operation of WYZZ-TV, including street address and WYZZ's permissions for use. With the exception of "Permitted Encumbrances" (as defined), all Real Property Interests are held by WYZZ subject to potential liens, mortgages, pledges, covenants, easements, restrictions, encroachments, leases, charges, and other claims or encumbrances that may impact WYZZ's ownership or use of the Real Property Interests. Each leasehold or subleasehold interest is included on Schedule 3L, although their legal validity, binding nature, enforceability, and current status are not guaranteed.

original: 7L. Labor. With respect to employees of WYZZ-TV:
ollama_generated:
7M. Employee Obligations (WYZZ-TV Employees):

In regard to the duties of WYZZ-TV's workforce:

(a) Scope of Work: Each employee agrees to perform their assigned duties faithfully and diligently, in accordance with the standards set forth by the Company.

(b) Working Hours: The Company may require employees to work during any hours that are necessary for the operation of WYZZ-TV, provided such hours do not exceed the legal limits as established by applicable laws and regulations. In the event that an employee is requested to work outside of their standard working hours, reasonable compensation shall be provided at the discretion of the Company.

(c) Training: The Company shall make reasonable efforts to provide training and development opportunities to employees, but it is understood that such opportunities are not guaranteed.

(d) Termination: Either party may terminate this employment relationship with written notice, subject to the terms set forth in the Employee Handbook or applicable law. Upon termination, any bonuses, commissions, and accrued but unused vacation time will be paid out promptly in accordance with Company policy.

(e) No Liability: The employee acknowledges that they are aware of the inherent risks involved in their role at WYZZ-TV and agree to hold harmless the Company, its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from any claims, demands, actions, suits, or proceedings arising out of or related to their employment with the Company.

(f) Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois without giving effect to its conflict of law provisions. Any dispute, controversy, or claim arising under this Agreement shall be resolved by binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association then in effect. The decision of the arbitrator shall be final and binding upon both parties, and judgment may be entered thereon in any court having jurisdiction.

(g) Amendment: This Agreement may only be amended in writing, signed by both parties, and executed in accordance with applicable law.

(h) Entire Agreement: This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties regarding the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous communications and agreements, whether written or oral, relating to the same subject matter. Any waiver, modification, or amendment of any provision of this Agreement shall not be effective unless in writing and signed by an authorized representative of each party.

(i) Assignment: Neither party may assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party, except that the Company may assign its rights and obligations to any affiliate or successor entity without such consent.

(j) Counterparts: This Agreement may be executed in counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Facsimile or electronic signatures shall be deemed binding as originals.

modified: (ii) Definition of Potential Environmental Issue. For the scope of this Agreement, "Potential Environmental Issue" encompasses any substance or material that could potentially be classified as a pollutant, contaminant, hazardous material (as defined in any applicable Environmental Law), toxic substance (as defined in any relevant Environmental Law), asbestos or asbestos-laden material, urea formaldehyde, polychlorinated biphenyls, regulated substances and wastes, radioactive materials, petroleum or petroleum by-products, including oil or any derivative thereof. original: (iii) Definition of Environmental Laws. "Environmental Laws" shall mean and include, but not be limited to, any applicable federal, state or local law, statute, charter, ordinance, rule, or regulation or any Governmental Body interpretation, policy, or guidance, including, without limitation, applicable safety/environmental/health laws, such as, but not limited to, the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act of 1976, Comprehensive Environmental Response Compensation and Liability Act, Federal Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Law, the Clean Air Act, the Clean Water Act, and the Toxic Substance Control Act, as any of the foregoing have been amended, and any Governmental Authorization or Order applicable to or affecting the Property or any other property (real or personal) used by or relating to WYZZ-TV or issued pursuant to any Environmental Laws which pertains to, governs, or controls the generation, storage, remediation, or removal of Contaminants, or otherwise regulates the protection of health and the environment, including, but not limited to, any of the following activities, whether on site or off site if such could materially affect the site: (i) the emission, discharge, release, spilling, or dumping of any Contaminant into the air, surface water, ground water, soil or substrata; or (ii) the use, generation, processing, sale, recycling treatment, handling, storage, disposal, transportation, labeling, or any other management of any Contaminant.
ollama_generated: (iii) Definition of Environmental Regulations: "Environmental Regulations" shall encompass, but not exclusively, any applicable federal, state, or local law, statute, charter, ordinance, rule, or regulation, as well as any Governmental Body's interpretation, policy, or guidance. This term includes, but is not limited to, safety/environmental/health laws such as the Resource Conservation and Recovery Act of 1976, Comprehensive Environmental Response Compensation and Liability Act, Federal Emergency Planning and Community Right-to-Know Law, Clean Air Act, Clean Water Act, and Toxic Substance Control Act. For clarification, these definitions include any future amendments to these laws and any Governmental Authorization or Order relevant to or impacting the Property, or any other property (real or personal) utilized by or associated with WYZZ-TV. These regulations apply to Environmental Regulations that pertain to, govern, or control the management, disposal, or handling of Contaminants, as well as those that regulate health and environmental protection. This includes activities related to the emission, discharge, release, spilling, or dumping of any Contaminant into the air, surface water, groundwater, soil, or substrata, or the use, generation, processing, sale, recycling, treatment, labeling, storage, transportation, or other management of any Contaminant. However, it is important to note that this definition does not imply a duty to comply with these regulations off-site unless such activities could potentially impact the site materially.
